ChatText: Are you ready to hit the road again, Gray Raven?
Since you've been out for quite a while, both your body and mind need rebuilding. Come get some exercise with me nearby.
You remember now? You seem to be recovering well.
We have to locate the Iron Army first if we want to take care of Death of Iron. Investigate with this as the goal.
Scherman Bastion, Rolling Stone Valley... Yeah, I agree with you.
There's no time to waste. I'll contact that traveling merchant. Come back to me once you're ready. We have to hurry.
That was a tough battle. Let's have some rest first.
Come back anytime you're ready to set off again.
Under siege by the Sanctuary soldiers, Rusty Yoke is suffering from a growing shortage of supplies. Things are not looking good.
Let's deal with the threat we have while thinking about how to attack the Halo Fortress.
Coordinating an inside-outside attack to capture the fortress is bold, but we have no other choice.
There's gonna be a tough battle. Come back to me when you're ready.
You're awake. Take a guess at where you're at. Sanctuary or Hell, take your pick.
If you're ready, let's go. A walk outside might help loosen up your nerves.
Remember everything now? Time to start the train and return to Hell.
Come to me when you're ready. Don't keep me waiting for too long.
It seems the influence of the Sanctuary has made Hell reflect the scenes of the human world. How disgusting.
Who knows what will happen if we keep dragging this out? Come find me when you have rested up, so we can keep going.
Let's not waste any time and attack those worthless fools now.
There seems to be some secret hidden deep within the Acheron River. Stay alert and keep moving forward.
The darker it gets, the more filthy bastards there are... Stay with me and don't move away.
Follow my flame and march toward Atlantis.
Finally got rid of those bastards... How are you? Still able to walk?
This is the deepest part of the Demon Fortress. Witch Haida might be just ahead. Come to me when you are ready.
Mm... we're leaving already? Never mind. Day or night, the sky looks the same anyway.
If you're rested, let's go.
So you remember. This time it's the reverse of when we first met.
It's okay if parts are fuzzy. I'll explain on the way to the orphanage.
Stay alert. We don't know where this horde came from.
Morigan may be right. We walked straight into the tribespeople's ritual site.
That same herbal scent from the castle...
Gray Raven, stick close. There may be more ambushes.
Let's move. The answers are ahead.
We've come this far. Whatever truth we find, we face it.
Thanks for staying with me, Gray Raven.
Still can't remember what happened?
No matter. I've already decided on our next stop: Whitehorse.
Hmm... the angels are acting a little strange.
They're not just picking up the gold that fell from the train. They're looking for something else.
It's been years, and Whitehorse has changed a lot.
Hm? You think I'll get sentimental coming back here? Don't worry. My memories of this place are far from fond.
Bloodsworn, there's one matter I ask you to leave to me: the spoils of war.
I have an old score to settle with the angels, and... I want to savor the taste of victory alone.
Hahahaha, Raphael...
No, it's nothing. Soon she'll regret ever crossing me.
Yes, just like that! Don't stop. Let all power bend to my will!
Bloodsworn... I knew you would return to me.
Want to chat with me? Sure, as long as you like. I'll always be here.
I will stay at the starting point and quietly await your triumphant return.
Come inside and rest for a bit if you are tired. I've prepared your favorite tea and snacks.
